frontmatter.title: PI3K Catalytic Subunits α and β Modulate Cell Death and IL-6 Secretion Induced by Talc Particles in Human Lung Carcinoma Cells
frontmatter.description: Hydrated magnesium silicate (or "talc" particles) is a sclerosis agent commonly used in the management of malignant pleural effusions (MPE), a common symptom of metastatic diseases including lung cancers. However, the direct effects of talc particles to lung carcinoma cells, which can be found in the MPE fluids from lung cancer patients, are not fully understood.
